meanings.sent1: The desert was the barrenest place I had ever seen, with no plants or crops in sight.
meanings.sent2: The barrenest field in the area yielded no harvest this season.
meanings.sent3: The barrenest garden in town was so empty, even the weeds refused to grow there.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like the barrenest land, unable to produce any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The barrenest landscape stretched out before us, a vast expanse of dry earth and rocks.

meanings.definition: Completely empty or devoid of something
meanings.sent1: The barrenest room in the house had no furniture or decorations.
meanings.sent2: The barrenest cupboard held only a single lonely plate.
meanings.sent3: The barrenest fridge in the office was devoid of any snacks or drinks.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like the barrenest wasteland, devoid of any love or joy.
meanings.sent5: The barrenest wasteland stretched out before us, a vast emptiness with no signs of life.

meanings.sent1: After hours of work, the experiment yielded the barrenest results imaginable.
meanings.sent2: The barrenest sales quarter in company history left everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking turned out to be the barrenest meal ever tasted.
meanings.sent4: The barrenest effort was put into the project, resulting in no progress at all.
meanings.sent5: The barrenest competition left him without any medals or recognition.
